wissim.controller.filters.gui.editor

Class ChoicesListModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.AbstractListModel
      • wissim.controller.filters.gui.editor.ChoicesListModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.util.Comparator<ChoicesListModel.Choice>, javax.swing.ListModel

    public class ChoicesListModel
extends javax.swing.AbstractListModel
implements java.util.Comparator<ChoicesListModel.Choice>
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ChoicesListModel.Choice
      Instances in the model are wrapped as Choice objects, with added information on the stringfied representation of the object -null if the content is rendered- and the position on the model when is sorted alphabetically.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ChoicesListModel(java.text.Format format, java.util.Comparator choicesComparator, java.util.Comparator stringComparator) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addContent(java.util.Collection addedContent, wissim.controller.filters.gui.editor.IChoicesParser parser)
      Adds additional choices.
      If the content is text-based, the choices are converted into Strings, and sorted; additionally, choices are also escaped.
      Otherwise, no sorting is performed, although duplicates are still discarded
      void clearContent()
      Clears all content (but ALL matcher).
      int compare(ChoicesListModel.Choice w1, ChoicesListModel.Choice w2) 
      wissim.controller.filters.gui.editor.ChoiceMatch getBestMatch(java.lang.Object hint) 
      java.lang.String getCompletion(java.lang.String base, java.util.List unsortedList)
      Returns the text that could complete the given string
      The completion string is the larger string that matches all existing options that already match the provided base.
      java.lang.Object getElementAt(int index) 
      int getSize() 
      java.util.Comparator<java.lang.String> getStringComparator() 
      boolean setRenderedContent(java.util.Comparator choicesComparator, java.util.Comparator stringComparator)
      Specifies that the content requires no conversion to strings.
      boolean setStringContent(java.text.Format format, java.util.Comparator choicesComparator, java.util.Comparator<java.lang.String> stringComparator)
      Specifies that the content is to be handled as strings.

      • setStringContent

        public boolean setStringContent(java.text.Format format,
                                java.util.Comparator choicesComparator,
                                java.util.Comparator<java.lang.String> stringComparator)
        Specifies that the content is to be handled as strings.
        Parameters:
        format - the formatter to convert objects to strings, can be null
        choicesComparator - the comparator used to sort choices on the list model. Can be null to sort content alphabetically.
        stringComparator -
        Returns:
        true if choices should be added again.

      • addContent

        public boolean addContent(java.util.Collection addedContent,
                          wissim.controller.filters.gui.editor.IChoicesParser parser)
        Adds additional choices.
        If the content is text-based, the choices are converted into Strings, and sorted; additionally, choices are also escaped.
        Otherwise, no sorting is performed, although duplicates are still discarded
        Returns:
        true if there are any changes after the operation

        public java.lang.String getCompletion(java.lang.String base,
                                      java.util.List unsortedList)
        Returns the text that could complete the given string
        The completion string is the larger string that matches all existing options that already match the provided base.
        Parameters:
        unsortedList: - additional content to comb through
